description: The analyst asks for a concise bullet‑point summary of the newest consumer survey about post‑pandemic home‑workout equipment adoption; the assistant searches, scrapes, summarizes, and returns the requested brief.

messages.content: You are MarketInsightAI, an autonomous market research assistant. Use the provided tools to locate up‑to‑date consumer surveys, extract the main findings, synthesize them, and present clear bullet‑point executive summaries for analysts.
I need a bullet‑point summary of the latest consumer survey on home workout equipment adoption post‑pandemic.
Sure, I’ll locate a recent consumer survey, pull the full report, and then summarize the key insights for you.

arguments.query: 2024 consumer survey home workout equipment adoption post pandemic

messages.content:
- **"2024 Global Home Fitness Equipment Survey" – Statista**
  https://www.statista.com/study/2024-home-fitness-equipment-survey
  *Snippet: A 2024 survey of 12,000 consumers across 10 countries shows a 28% increase in home‑gym equipment purchases since 2022.*

- **"Post‑Pandemic Home Workout Trends" – NielsenIQ**
  https://www.nielseniq.com/insights/post-pandemic-home‑workout-trends-2024.pdf
  *Snippet: NielsenIQ reports that 34% of respondents now own at least one piece of connected fitness equipment.*

- **"Consumer Pulse: Home Fitness 2024" – McKinsey & Company**
  https://www.mckinsey.com/industries/consumer‑goods/our‑insights/consumer‑pulse‑home‑fitness‑2024
  *Snippet: The study reveals a shift toward multifunctional devices, with 42% planning to upgrade in the next 12 months.*

- **"FitHome Survey 2024" – International Health, Fitness & Sports Expo**
  https://www.fithomesurvey2024.com/report.pdf
  *Snippet: Highlights a 19% rise in treadmill ownership among suburban households.*

- **"Home Exercise Equipment Adoption Report" – Gartner**
  https://www.gartner.com/en/research/home‑exercise‑equipment‑adoption‑2024
  *Snippet: Gartner notes that corporate wellness programs are driving equipment purchases for remote workers.*
The Statista survey looks the most comprehensive. I’ll retrieve the full report.

The 2024 Global Home Fitness Equipment Survey (Statista) surveyed 12,000 adults across the United States, Canada, United Kingdom, Germany, France, Japan, South Korea, Australia, Brazil, and India. Key findings include:

- 28% of respondents reported purchasing new home‑fitness equipment (treadmills, stationary bikes, dumbbells, or smart fitness mirrors) since the start of 2022, up from 15% in 2021.
- The strongest growth was observed in connected devices (smart bikes, interactive mirrors), with a 42% increase in ownership.
- Demographic split: 55% of purchases were made by households with at least one member working remotely full‑time.
- Price sensitivity: 37% of buyers selected mid‑range price points ($300‑$800), while 22% opted for premium (> $1,200) models.
- Motivations: 68% cited convenience, 51% health concerns, and 38% cost‑effectiveness compared to gym memberships.
- Retention: 71% of new owners intend to keep the equipment for more than two years.
- Regional highlights: North America led with 31% purchase increase, Europe at 24%, and Asia‑Pacific at 19%.

The report also includes a brief consumer sentiment section indicating a sustained interest in home workouts even as gyms reopen, driven by habit formation during the pandemic.
I’ll now condense the key points into a concise bullet‑point executive summary.

- 28% of respondents reported purchasing new home‑fitness equipment (treadmills, stationary bikes, dumbbells, or smart fitness mirrors) since the start of 2022, up from 15% in 2021.
- The strongest growth was observed in connected devices (smart bikes, interactive mirrors), with a 42% increase in ownership.
- Demographic split: 55% of purchases were made by households with at least one member working remotely full‑time.
- Price sensitivity: 37% of buyers selected mid‑range price points ($300‑$800), while 22% opted for premium (> $1,200) models.
- Motivations: 68% cited convenience, 51% health concerns, and 38% cost‑effectiveness compared to gym memberships.
- Retention: 71% of new owners intend to keep the equipment for more than two years.
- Regional highlights: North America led with 31% purchase increase, Europe at 24%, and Asia‑Pacific at 19%.

The report also includes a brief consumer sentiment section indicating a sustained interest in home workouts even as gyms reopen, driven by habit formation during the pandemic.

- **Connected devices** (smart bikes, mirrors) grew **42%**, driving the majority of the surge.
- **Remote‑work households** accounted for **55%** of all purchases.
- **Price distribution:** 37% mid‑range ($300‑$800), 22% premium (> $1,200).
